This class handles three basic functions.  First, it maintains the positioning information for the current session (in both AR space and in geolocation space).  Second, it handles the alignment of map space to the current AR space.  Third, it manages the rendering of content in the AR scene.

This class encompasses a map consisting of cloud anchors (nodes) and paths connecting cloud
anchors (edges).  This class is mainly a datastructure and other classes access its data for
performing operations (e.g., path planning)

This class implements a basic approach to aligning an

to a specified map.  The basic approach is to use a voting scheme where cloud anchors each vote for a transform that will align the two spaces in questions (route space and session space).  In the case of a tie, primacy is given to the transform that agrees as much as possible with the current transform estimate.

This type is used to specify to the ChooseAnchorComponentView whether we are choosing the anchor in the context of indoor or outdoor navigation.  Further, if indoors, we differentiate between the start and end of a route
